books.description: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning. Read by the author. 31 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE COVENANT OF WATER

books.author: Barbara Kingsolver
books.description: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia. Read by Charlie Thurston. 21 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DEMON COPPERHEAD

books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.description: The fifth book in A Court of Thorns and Roses series. Nesta Archeron is forced into close quarters with a warrior named Cassian. Read by Stina Nielsen. 26 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A COURT OF SILVER FLAMES

books.author: Britney Spears
books.description: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WOMAN IN ME

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Liz Cheney
books.description: The former congresswoman from Wyoming recounts how she helped lead the Select Committee to Investigate the Jan. 6. Attack on the United States Capitol. Read by the author. 12 hours, 14 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OATH AND HONOR

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively. Read by Will Patton, Ann Marie Lee and Danny Campbell. 9 hours, 45 minutes unabridged.
books.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON

books.author: Daniel James Brown
books.description: The story of the American rowers who pursued gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games; the basis of the film. Read by Edward Herrmann. 14 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BOYS IN THE BOAT

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Matthew Perry
books.description: The actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety. Read by the author. 8 hours, 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence. Read by Jeremy Bobb. 20 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ELON MUSK

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events. Read by Dion Graham and the author. 8 hours, 28 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WAGER

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Barbra Streisand
books.description: The EGOT winner chronicles her journey in show business and reveals details about some of her personal relationships. Read by the author. 48 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MY NAME IS BARBRA

books.author: Prince Harry
books.description: The Duke of Sussex details his struggles with the royal family, loss of his mother, service in the British Army and marriage to Meghan Markle. Read by the author. 15 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SPARE

books.author: Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today. Read by Robin Miles. 14 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CASTE

books.author: Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.contributor: by Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.title: THE CREATIVE ACT

books.contributor: by Arthur C. Brooks and Oprah Winfrey
books.title: BUILD THE LIFE YOU WANT

books.title: I WILL TEACH YOU TO BE RICH, SECOND EDITION

books.author: Mustafa Suleyman with Michael Bhaskar
books.contributor: by Mustafa Suleyman with Michael Bhaskar
books.title: THE COMING WAVE

books.author: Tui T. Sutherland.
books.contributor: by Tui T. Sutherland. Illustrated by Mike Holmes
books.description: The seventh book in the Wings of Fire graphic novel series. Winter must face his family in the Ice Kingdom.
books.title: WINTER TURNING

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The fifth book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. As publication seems possible, the baby frogs feel doubt.
books.title: INFLUENCERS

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Arley Nopra
books.description: The 15th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Things escalate when a practical joker causes Claudia to break her leg.
books.title: CLAUDIA AND THE BAD JOKE

books.description: Charlie wants to take his relationship with Nick, who will go to university next year, to a new level.
books.title: HEARTSTOPPER, VOL. 5

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Ellen T. Crenshaw
books.description: The 14th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Members of the club have different reactions to visiting New York City.
books.title: STACEY'S MISTAKE

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
books.title: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA

books.author: Scott Cawthon, Elley Cooper and Andrea Waggener.
books.contributor: by Scott Cawthon, Elley Cooper and Andrea Waggener. Illustrated by Diana Camero, Coryn MacPherson and Ben Sawyer
books.contributor_note: Illustrated by Diana Camero, Coryn MacPherson and Ben Sawyer
books.description: Three stories adapted into a graphic novel by Christopher Hastings.
books.title: FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S: FAZBEAR FRIGHTS, COLLECTION, VOL. 4

books.title: SOLO LEVELING, VOL. 8

books.author: Tatsuki Fujimoto
books.description: Asa’s new friend may have a secret and Denji questions his own competence as he considers revealing his identity.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN, VOL. 13

books.author: Francine Pascal.
books.contributor: by Francine Pascal. Illustrated by Claudia Aguirre
books.description: The third book in the Sweet Valley Twins graphic novel series. Loyalties are tested when Amy considers trying out for a cheering squad. Adapted by Nicole Andelfinger.
books.title: CHOOSING SIDES

books.author: Kayla Miller
books.description: The sixth book in the Click graphic novel series. Things come up for Olive when she spends her spring break with her father in the city.
books.title: BREAK

books.author: Naoya Matsumoto
books.description: Kafka trains under Hoshina while Kikoru gets permission to inherit a memento her mother once owned.
books.title: KAIJU NO. 8, VOL. 9

books.author: Gege Akutami
books.description: Hakari and Panda get separated when they search for Kashimo at the Tokyo No. 2 Colony.
books.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN, VOL. 21

books.author: Kentaro Miura
books.description: A swordsman teams up with the leader of a mercenary band to fight evil forces; collects the first three issues of the manga series.
books.title: BERSERK DELUXE, VOL. 1

books.author: Aaron Blabey
books.description: The 18th book in the Bad Guys series. New revelations emerge as one character finds her voice.
books.title: THE BAD GUYS IN LOOK WHO'S TALKING

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: A divorced mother of twins and chief executive of a luxury department store goes against a wealthy investor looking to take it over.
books.title: WORTHY OPPONENTS

books.author: J.D. Robb
books.description: The 57th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas looks into the death of an internal affairs captain.
books.title: PAYBACK IN DEATH

books.author: David Baldacci
books.description: The third book in the Archer series. Archer, Dash and Callahan search for a missing screenwriter who had a dead body turn up in her home.
books.title: DREAM TOWN

books.author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
books.description: The 22nd book in the Women’s Murder Club series. Lindsay Boxer returns as word gets around about a shipment of drugs and weapons.
books.title: 22 SECONDS

books.author: John Sandford
books.description: Letty Davenport, the adopted daughter of Lucas Davenport, looks into oil thefts in Texas.
books.title: THE INVESTIGATOR

books.author: Sandra Brown
books.description: A late-night radio show host advises a listener to leave her boyfriend and he threatens to get his revenge on them.
books.title: HELLO, DARKNESS

books.author: Lee Child
books.description: The 11th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher must discover who is hunting members of a team of former military investigators.
books.title: BAD LUCK AND TROUBLE

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: An unmarried wedding planner contends with problems, secrets and scandals.
books.title: THE WEDDING PLANNER

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: The attorney Sebastian Rudd is a “lone gunman” who hates injustice and the system and defends unpopular clients.
books.title: ROGUE LAWYER

books.author: Nora Roberts
books.description: Two romance stories: “Falling for Rachel” and “Convincing Alex.”
books.title: WILD HEART

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: Preacher helps a group of Norwegian settlers protect their land.
books.title: PREACHER'S BLOODY RAMPAGE

books.author: Harlan Coben
books.description: A retired Army helicopter pilot faces combat-related nightmares and mysteries concerning the deaths of her husband and sister.
books.title: FOOL ME ONCE

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
books.title: THE BOYS FROM BILOXI

books.author: Lee Child
books.description: In the first book in the Jack Reacher series, Child’s ex-military investigator is just passing through Margrave, Ga., when he’s arrested for murder.
books.title: KILLING FLOOR

books.author: Patricia Cornwell
books.description: The 26th book in the Kay Scarpetta series. Scarpetta becomes a star witness in a televised murder trial and the judge’s sister is found dead.
